SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.Network

Class ServerImplementation

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
it.polimi.ingsw.Network.ServerImplementation
All Implemented Interfaces:
Server, Serializable, Remote
public class ServerImplementation extends UnicastRemoteObject implements Server
The ServerImplementation class represents the server implementation for the game. It handles the communication with clients using both RMI (Remote Method Invocation) and socket protocols.

The class implements the Server interface, which defines the communication methods that clients can invoke. It extends the UnicastRemoteObject class to enable remote method invocation (RMI) functionality.

The ServerImplementation class maintains a list of connected players (`playingUsernames`) and a map of disconnected players (`disconnectedUsernames`). It also keeps a queue of lobbies waiting to start (`lobbiesWaitingToStart`).

The class provides methods to handle incoming messages from clients. The `handleMessage` method processes register messages to connect clients to their respective `GameServer` instances and reconnect messages to reconnect clients to their previous GameServer instances.

The class also provides methods to delete a game, disconnect a player, kick a player from a lobby, and handle player reconnection. These methods ensure the appropriate management of players and game instances.

The ServerImplementation class supports both RMI and socket communication protocols. The `startRMI` method starts the RMI server, while the `startSocket` method starts the socket server. Incoming socket connections are handled by the ClientSkeleton class.

The class includes a singleton pattern to ensure that only one instance of the server exists. The `getInstance` method returns the singleton instance of the server.

The `main` method starts the server by creating the singleton instance and starting the RMI and socket server threads. It also sets up the logger to log server activities.

Note: The ServerImplementation class assumes that the game logic and state are managed by the GameServer class, which is responsible for handling the game lobby and the game itself.

    • getInstance

      public static ServerImplementation getInstance() throws RemoteException
      Returns the singleton instance of the server. If the instance does not exist, it creates a new one.
      Returns:
      the singleton instance of the ServerImplementation.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a Remote Exception occurred.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The entry point of the server application. It creates an instance of the server, starts the RMI and socket servers, and logs the server start.
      Parameters:
      args - the command line arguments

    • handleMessage

      public void handleMessage(Message m, Client client) throws RemoteException
      Handles the incoming Message from a Client. It adds the message to the queue of messages to be processed.
      Specified by:
      handleMessage in interface Server
      Parameters:
      m - the incoming Message
      client - the Client object associated with the message
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if there is an error in remote method invocation

    • deleteGame

      protected void deleteGame(List<String> players)
      Deletes the game associated with the given list of Players. Removes the players from the active and disconnected players collections.
      Parameters:
      players - the list of Player to be removed from the game

    • disconnect

      protected void disconnect(String username, GameServer gameServer)
      Disconnects a player from the server. Updates collections of active and disconnected players accordingly.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player to disconnect
      gameServer - the GameServer object associated with the player

    • kick

      protected void kick(String username, GameServer lobby)
      Kicks a player from the specified lobby. If the lobby becomes empty after the player is kicked, it is removed from the lobbies queue.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player to kick
      lobby - the GameServer object representing the lobby
